intro: Leiothrix dielsii var. vilavelhensis, commonly known as the Vilavelhensis Leiothrix, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
